scenarioDescription:
The GJ 3138 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 3138 is a star with 0.68 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.5 times its radius. It is located 92.86 light years away from the solar system.

GJ 3138 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 3138 system


GJ 3138 b

GJ 3138 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2017-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 3138 b is 1.781 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 3138 b is 1.180 that of Earth. At 1.781 Earth masses, GJ 3138 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.


GJ 3138 c

GJ 3138 c was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2017-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 3138 c is 4.182 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 3138 c is 1.880 that of Earth. With a mass below 5 Earth masses, a density of 3.46, and a semi-major axis of 0.057 astronomical units, GJ 3138 c could, potentially, be an ocean world - a planet with no dry land.


GJ 3138 d

GJ 3138 d was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2017-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.70 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 3138 d is 10.507 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 3138 d is 3.230 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, GJ 3138 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system GJ 3138, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the La Silla Observatory.
name: GJ 3138 - System With 3 Exolanets
